Description: The temptation of St Anthony, after Teniers; with the saint reading a book at a table, a dog-headed creature and a monkey-headed one standing at right, a hooded figure holding a torch kneeling in the right foreground, a bat flying above the saint Wood-engraving on chine collé
Curator's comments: Identified in the department register as a temptation of St Anthony after Teniers. Possibly one of the thirteen wood-engravings executed by Gauchard for Charles Blanc's 'Histoire des Peintres', c.1840 (IFF 1).
Bibliographic references: IFF / Inventaire du Fonds Français: Bibliothèque Nationale, Département des Estampes (not described?)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
